markdown.markdown: ## Standards ### For displaying figures: ![](figs/unit1_data_dgp.png){width=100% fig-align="center"} ### For displaying code and even variable names `demo <- function(x)` `variable_2` ### For sizing graphs and code-generated plots * You can specify out-height or out-width as either pixels, inches, or percentages * You can specify both using different units * If you specify only one, the other should default to "auto" which keeps the figured scaled as in the original ```{r } #| out-width: 3in #| out-height: 100% plot(pressure) ``` ### For code annotation ```{r} library(tidyverse) d <- tibble (x = 1:5) |> # <1> glimpse() # <2> ``` 1. make a df 2. glimpse a df ### For displaying color (like red questions) [this sentence is in red]{.red} This is an alternative method but more complex: I love R. [red]{.red} [yellow]{.yellow} [green]{.green} [blue]{.blue} [yellow background]{.yellowb} for better contrast ### Callouts for questions ::: {.callout-important"} # This is the question you want displayed? ::: ::: {.fragment .uwred} Here's the answer! This can be as long as you want and contain text, code, output etc ::: ### Conditional Content Use divs to specify content to only appear in certain formats: ::: {.content-visible when-format="html"} Will only appear in HTML. ::: ::: {.content-visible when-format="revealjs"} Will only appear in revealJS ::: ### Links to qmd files as plaintext Normally, a link to a qmd file functions as a link to the rendered html of that file. To link to a qmd file that is to be downloaded or viewed as raw text, you must link to the raw.github user content: - cleaning EDA: [qmd](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jjcurtin/book_iaml/main/application_assignments/unit_02/hw_unit_02_cleaning.qmd) - modeling EDA: [qmd](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jjcurtin/book_iaml/main/application_assignments/unit_02/hw_unit_02_modeling.qmd)
markdown.srcMarkdownNoYaml: # Test ## Standards ### For displaying figures: ![](figs/unit1_data_dgp.png){width=100% fig-align="center"} ### For displaying code and even variable names `demo <- function(x)` `variable_2` ### For sizing graphs and code-generated plots * You can specify out-height or out-width as either pixels, inches, or percentages * You can specify both using different units * If you specify only one, the other should default to "auto" which keeps the figured scaled as in the original ```{r } #| out-width: 3in #| out-height: 100% plot(pressure) ``` ### For code annotation ```{r} library(tidyverse) d <- tibble (x = 1:5) |> # <1> glimpse() # <2> ``` 1. make a df 2. glimpse a df ### For displaying color (like red questions) [this sentence is in red]{.red} This is an alternative method but more complex: I love R. [red]{.red} [yellow]{.yellow} [green]{.green} [blue]{.blue} [yellow background]{.yellowb} for better contrast ### Callouts for questions ::: {.callout-important"} # This is the question you want displayed? ::: ::: {.fragment .uwred} Here's the answer! This can be as long as you want and contain text, code, output etc ::: ### Conditional Content Use divs to specify content to only appear in certain formats: ::: {.content-visible when-format="html"} Will only appear in HTML. ::: ::: {.content-visible when-format="revealjs"} Will only appear in revealJS ::: ### Links to qmd files as plaintext Normally, a link to a qmd file functions as a link to the rendered html of that file. To link to a qmd file that is to be downloaded or viewed as raw text, you must link to the raw.github user content: - cleaning EDA: [qmd](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jjcurtin/book_iaml/main/application_assignments/unit_02/hw_unit_02_cleaning.qmd) - modeling EDA: [qmd](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jjcurtin/book_iaml/main/application_assignments/unit_02/hw_unit_02_modeling.qmd)
